item.title: R Graphing Workshop
item.description: The aim of this workshop is to teach you the ins and outs of using the ggplot2 package in R. The materials for this workshop can be found here. A lot of the information in this workshop is based on workshops given at Harvard: https://dss.iq.harvard.edu/workshop-materials Please make good use of the following cheat sheet! https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/ggplot2-cheatsheet.pdf Data The data I will be using during this tutorial is from the University of Wisconsinâ€™s X-Ray Microbeam Speech Production Database.

item.title: R Modeling Workshop
item.description: The aim of this workshop is to teach you the basics of statistical models in R. The materials for this workshop can be found here. What is the point? When looking at data, we want to determine if there is a relationship between our independent and dependent variables. A traditional method of analysis in Linguistics and associated fields is regression analysis, which helps understand how a particular variable (the dependent variable) changes when other variables (independent variables, or predictors) are varied.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
